bug.short_desc: Fedora 25 comes with MP3-Support but does not support MP3
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Gnome-software does not find the MP3 codex.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): gnome-software-3.22.2-1.fc25.x86_64 totem-3.22.0-1.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Try to play an MP3-file in Fedora 25 (i use totem) 2. Gnome-software opens and and is searching for the codec 3. Gnome-software does not find the codec
Actual results: Gnome-software does not find the codec
Expected results: Gnome-software should find the codec
Additional info: The message from gnome-software is:
Unable to Find Requested Software; Unfortunately, the MPEG-1 Layer 3 (MP3) decoder you were searching for could not be found. Please see this website for more information.
Totem says: $ totem test.mp3 ** Message: Missing plugin: gstreamer|1.0|totem|MPEG-1 Layer 3 (MP3) decoder|decoder-audio/mpeg, mpegversion=(int)1, layer=(int)3 (MPEG-1 Layer 3 (MP3) decoder) ** Message: PackageKit: xid = 33554447 ** Message: PackageKit: desktop_id = org.gnome.Totem.desktop ** Message: PackageKit: Codec nice name: MPEG-1 Layer 3 (MP3) decoder ** Message: PackageKit: field is: mpegversion, type: gint ** Message: PackageKit: field is: layer, type: gint ** Message: PackageKit: structure: gstreamer1(decoder-audio/mpeg)(mpegversion=1)(layer=3)()(64bit) ** Message: Missing plugins installed. Updating plugin registry ... ** Message: Plugin registry updated, trying again.

(In reply to Paul W. Frields from comment #1) > Possibly related to bug 1349378?
Yes, but the fix for that bug (crash) does not fix this bug (codec).

This bug is not fixed in gnome-software-3.22.3-1.fc25.
(https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=821787)

The workarounds for this bug are as follows.
(1) Install the plugin manually,
# dnf install gstreamer1-plugin-mpg123
or (2) use the repos from rpmfusion as usual, and gnome-software will find and install those plugins:
https://rpmfusion.org/Configuration/

Thanks, should be fixed upstream with:
https://git.gnome.org/browse/gnome-software/commit/?id=5fcf4144a16cea8aac3cf80c4a76b54e0b2dba80 and https://git.gnome.org/browse/gnome-software/commit/?id=054d7a3270110dda74b14d34a9e6e45b3af9a20e
appstream-data-25-14.fc25 gstreamer1-plugin-mpg123-1.10.2-3.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8fb56949f3
This bug is fixed in gnome-software-3.22.5-1.fc25. Closing...

appstream-data-25-14.fc25, gstreamer1-plugin-mpg123-1.10.2-3.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8fb56949f3
appstream-data-25-14.fc25, gstreamer1-plugin-mpg123-1.10.2-3.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
